docs.lead_paragraph: In Ohio, a bill that would ban abortions once a fetal heartbeat is detectable — usually six to eight weeks into pregnancy — is the latest effort by activists to force a legal showdown.

headline.seo: Ohio Bill Splits Anti-Abortion Forces on Legal Tactics
headline.main: Anti-Abortion Groups Are Split on Legal Tactics
headline.print_headline: Anti-Abortion Groups Are Split on Legal Tactics

docs.abstract: Anti-abortion movement is increasingly divided, as grass-roots activists demand all-out legal assault on Roe v Wade in the hope that the Supreme Court is ready to consider a radical change in the ruling; longtime leaders of movement consider new approach reckless; rift is especially notable in Ohio where there is a bill before the legislature that would ban abortions once a fetal heartbeat is detectable, usually six to eight weeks into pregnancy.
docs.snippet: In Ohio, a bill that would ban abortions once a fetal heartbeat is detectable — usually six to eight weeks into pregnancy — is the latest effort by activists to force a legal showdown.

docs.abstract: Bruce Handy reviews books Lighthouse Christmas, written by Toni Buzzeo and illustrated by Nancy Carpenter, and A Christmas Tree for Pyn, written and illustrated by Olivier Dunrea.

docs.lead_paragraph: As a House proposal threatens to cut financing, policy experts worry about the future of initiatives to make government dollars go further and work better.

headline.seo: Programs Tying Federal Money to Policy Outcomes May Be at Risk
headline.main: Programs That Tie Funds to Effectiveness Are at Risk
headline.print_headline: Programs That Tie Funds to Effectiveness Are at Risk

docs.abstract: Policy experts worry about the future of initiatives to make government dollars go further and work better, as a House proposal threatens to cut financing of numerous social programs.
docs.snippet: As a House proposal threatens to cut financing, policy experts worry about the future of initiatives to make government dollars go further and work better.

docs.lead_paragraph: What do seven billion people mean for an already strained planet? Three experts share their perspectives.
docs.snippet: What do seven billion people mean for an already strained planet? Three experts share their perspectives.

byline.original: By HANIA ZLOTNIK, CHANDRAN NAIR and FRED PEARCE

docs.lead_paragraph: A woman was charged with self-abortion in the first degree, the police said Thursday, becoming only the fifth woman charged with self-abortion since 1980.

headline.seo: Self-Abortion Charge After Fetus Found in Trash in Washington Heights
headline.main: After Fetus Is Found in Trash, a Rare Charge of Self-Abortion
headline.print_headline: After Fetus Is Found in Trash, A Rare Charge of Self-Abortion

docs.abstract: Yaribely Almonte becomes the fifth woman in New York State since 1980 to be charged with self-abortion in the first degree, a misdemeanor; Almonte left her aborted fetus in household garbage at her apartment building in the Washington Heights section of Manhattan.
docs.snippet: A woman was charged with self-abortion in the first degree, the police said Thursday, becoming only the fifth woman charged with self-abortion since 1980.

byline.contributor: Al Baker and Daniel Krieger contributed reporting.

docs.lead_paragraph: Ms. Lewis, the daughter of an unwed Loretta Young and Clark Gable, was 31 before she confronted her mother and learned the truth of her upbringing.

headline.seo: Judy Lewis, Secret Daughter of Hollywood, Dies at 76
headline.main: Judy Lewis, Secret Daughter of Hollywood, Dies at 76
headline.print_headline: Judy Lewis, Secret Daughter of Hollywood, Dies at 76

docs.abstract: Judy Lewis, former actress who was the daughter of Loretta Young and Clark Gable, but did not learn the full truth about her parents until she was 31, dies at age 76.
docs.snippet: Ms. Lewis, the daughter of an unwed Loretta Young and Clark Gable, was 31 before she confronted her mother and learned the truth of her upbringing.
